That's great to hear that you're already incorporating some of the exercises from the workshop into your daily routine!

Strengthening your glutes and core is essential for runners, as it can help improve your running form, reduce your risk of injury, and even boost your performance. Here are some exercises that I highly recommend:

**Glute Exercises:**

1. **Glute Bridges**: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Slowly lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top, and then lower back down. (3 sets of 12-15 reps)
2. **Side Lying Leg Lifts**: Lie on your side with your feet touching and lift your top leg up towards the ceiling. Lower it back down and repeat. (3 sets of 12-15 reps on each side)
3. **Donkey Kicks**: Start on your hands and knees. Lift one leg up and back, keeping your knee bent at a 90-degree angle. Lower it back down and repeat. (3 sets of 12-15 reps on each side)
4. **Step-Ups**: Use a stair or step, and step up with one foot. Bring the other foot up to meet it, then step back down to the starting position. (3 sets of 12-15 reps on each side)

**Core Exercises:**

1. **Plank**: Hold a plank position for 30-60 seconds, engaging your core muscles to support your body. (3 sets)
2. **Russian twists**: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground. Twist your torso to touch your hands to the ground on either side of you. (3 sets of 12-15 reps)
3. **Leg Raises**: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and raise your legs straight up towards the ceiling. Lower them back down and repeat. (3 sets of 12-15 reps)
4. **Bird Dog**: Start on your hands and knees. Lift your right arm and left leg off the ground and hold for a few seconds. Lower them back down and repeat on the other side. (3 sets of 12-15 reps on each side)

Remember to start slow and gradually increase the intensity and difficulty as you build strength. It's also essential to focus on proper form and engage your core muscles to get the most out of these exercises.

In addition to these exercises, here are some general tips to help you strengthen your glutes and core:

* Engage your core muscles during exercise by drawing your belly button towards your spine.
* Focus on slow and controlled movements to ensure you're targeting the correct muscles.
* Incorporate exercises that challenge your balance and stability, such as single-leg squats or balance boards.
* Make sure to stretch your glutes and core after exercise to help with recovery and reduce muscle soreness.

I hope these exercises and tips help you strengthen your glutes and core! Do you have any specific questions about these exercises or any other running-related topics?
